intro: Pleopeltis subsparsa, commonly known as the sparse-veined rock fern, is a species of epiphytic fern native to Southeast Asia. It typically grows on tree trunks and rocks in humid, shaded environments. The plant has lanceolate,革质 (leathery) leaves with a dense network of veins. Its rhizomes are wiry and help anchor it to its substrate. It is valued for its ornamental appearance and is often cultivated in tropical gardens.
